intro: Thapsia nestleri subsp. nestleri, commonly known as the Canary Island thapsia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbrella-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and often covered in a dense layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. The showy white or yellow flowers appear in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
